thread.title: Week ahead: US employment report, Catalan elections in focus
thread.title_full: Week ahead: US employment report, Catalan elections in focus

title: Week ahead: US employment report, Catalan elections in focus
text:
900.00 -2.50 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - The coming week will see a raft of economic indicators come out of the US, with the latest reading on US unemployment on Friday chief among them. Although in her post-FOMC meeting press conference Janet Yellen seemingly downgraded the importance of the labour market in the central bank's reaction function, it nevertheless remains a critical report for markets. 
Other data due out on the other side of the Pond with the potential to sway capital markets includes a reading on the state of manufacturing in the upper Mid-West, the Chicago Purchasing Managers' Index for September, on Wednesday. 
The inflation numbers contained in Monday's release on US personal income and spending for August may also draw some attention. 
In the UK, Tuesday will see the Bank of England update on consumer credit and money supply. 
Over in the euro area, traders will keep an eye out for the preliminary reading on consumer price inflation and final September data on manufacturing. 
On Friday, the Bank of Japan will publish its Tankan survey of short-term business confidence. 
Lastly, over the coming weekend voters in the north-eastern Spanish autonomous region of Catalonia will head to the polls. Pro-secession parties are expected to win a majority of the seats in the regional parliament, thanks to the way in which voting circumscriptions are drawn up - granting more than proportional representation to small towns. However, it remains to be seen whether they will garner a majority of the popular vote, some analysts said. 
In any case, the vote succinctly summarizes the political risks some countries face as decades-old, when not centuries old, political tensions coincide with post-crisis austerity.
